Sentencas: The direct utilization of ethanol was investigated ill Cu-CeO2, Cu-Zr0.35Ce0.65O2 (ZDC) and Cu/Ru-Zr0.35Ce0.65O2 anodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cells were tested in both hydrogen and ethanol.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The Outlet gas composition was monitored with a gas chromatograph, which showed that almost all the ethanol was decomposed, mainly to H-2, CH4, CO, H2O and C2H4.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum power outputs obtained in ethanol were 0.075 and 0.400 W/cm(2) on Cu CeO2|YSZ|LSM and Cu-ZDC|YSZ|LSM, respectively.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All cells were more active in alcohol than in hydrogen with the peak performance occurring after approximately 4 h. That is, the power density initially increased.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This behavior was likely a consequence of carbon deposition that initially results in all improvement of the electronic conductivity in the anode but later results in the blocking of the active sites.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Zirconia doping (in the ZDC anodes) resulted in better stability and, in addition, the initial activity of the ZDC anodes could be recovered after approximately 1 h Of exposure to humidified hydrogen, whereas the initial activity of the ceria anodes could not he recovered.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The addition of ruthenium (<0.5 wt%) further improved the stability by delaying the onset of carbon formation.
Titulo: Direct utilization of ethanol on ceria-based anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
